title: Sam Smith goes glam in a lacy sheer kimono with matching trousers at the Attitude Awards
text:
Sam Smith recently came out publicly as non-binary, revealing to fans that they do define themselves exclusively as masculine or feminine.

And the singer, 27, was seen putting their best sartorial foot forward on Wednesday, when they stepped out for the Virgin Atlantic Attitude Awards at London's Roundhouse, where they were named Person of the Year.

The Dancing With A stranger hitmaker commanded attention in a nightwear-inspired co-ord, which featured a lacy sheer kimono top and matching palazzo trousers.

Stepping out: Sam Smith was seen putting their best sartorial foot forward on Wednesday night, when they stepped out for the annual Attitude Awards at London's Roundhouse

Teaming the eye-catching ensemble with a plain green top, the star accessorised with jewellery that included a gold cross and flower earrings and a bold pendant.

Standing tall in a pair of black leather boots, the British musician struck a series of poses for photographers before mingling with a host of famous guests – including Cheryl Joan Collins, Katherine Jenkins, and Taron Egerton – at the glittering gala.

With the Attitude Awards in its eight year, 600 VIP guests dined while 13 awards celebrating the LGBTQ community were handed out, between live performances.

Glam in green: The Dancing With A stranger hitmaker commanded attention in a nightwear-inspired co-ord, which featured a lacy sheer kimono top and matching palazzo trousers

Details: Teaming the eye-catching ensemble with a plain green top, the star accessorised with jewellery that included a gold cross and flower earrings and a bold pendant

Sam's appearance at the awards ceremony comes just days after they stepped out for a fun-filled outing in New York City with a group of pals.

On Sunday, the star took to Instagram to share footage of themselves twerking on the Big Apple's Brooklyn Bridge after dancing in the middle of the street.

Dressed in a textured brown button-down shirt and dark skinny jeans, the London native also indulged in a spot of playful voguing while holding a fan.

Before stepping out for the day of lighthearted shenanigans, the star shared a shot of themselves wearing a tank top as they partied, presumably the night before.

Pals: Inside the event, the Stay With Me hitmaker was seen cosying up to fellow singer Cheryl

Plunging: Cheryl turned heads in a deeply plunging green dress, teamed with thigh-high boots

Captioning the image, which showed the star sporting heavy eyeliner and showing a tattoo of two people kissing, they wrote: 'I love my friends.'

Sam's outings comes after they revealed their crush on pop heartthrob Harry Styles in a clip entitled My Teenage Self, shared by Hits Radio.

The singer couldn't keep their cool as they dubbed the former One Direction star 'so fit' while also declaring they 'lost their breath' after seeing him recently.

Opening up a box which was full of question for them to answer, Sam gushed: 'It says, "I love Harry Styles on it", and I do!'

Unable to contain their glee, they continued: 'I've seen him recently. He's so fit, like I lose my breath.'

Social butterfly: Londoner Sam also posed for snaps with Sophie Ellis-Bextor and Glyn Fussell

Chatting: As the night progressed, glam Sam was seen enjoying a one-on-one chat with Cheryl

When asked later in the interview who their celebrity crush was that they have yet to meet, they answered Shia LaBeouf.

However, talk once again steered back to the Dunkirk actor, as they gushed: 'I've met him and he's better than what he looks like on TV. Sensational!'

Sam also confessed that they also thought Leonardo DiCaprio was 'stunning', adding: 'He came up to me just before Oscars and said, "Hello, I like your music." I said I liked him.'

Last month, Sam broke their silence on coming out as non-binary, as the singer told fans to refer to them using 'they/them' pronouns.

The How Do You Sleep? hitmaker announced their request in a candid statement shared via Twitter, in which they admitted they have been 'at war' with themselves for 'a lifetime' over how to define their gender.

Vogue: On Sunday, the 27-year-old singer shared footage of themselves voguing on New York City's Brooklyn Bridge as they enjoyed a fun-filled outing with pals

Off to twerk we go: As the posts continued, Sam showed themselves twerking on the bridge

Dancing in the street: They also got into the spirit of things in the middle of the busy streets

In the flurry of tweets, they wrote: 'Today is a good day so here goes. I’ve decided I am changing my pronouns to THEY/THEM after a lifetime of being at war with my gender I’ve decided to embrace myself for who I am, inside and out...

'I’m so excited and privileged to be surrounded by people that support me in this decision but I’ve been very nervous about announcing this because I care too much about what people think but f*** it!

'I understand there will be many mistakes and mis gendering but all I ask is you please please try. I hope you can see me like I see myself now. Thank you.'

A person who identifies as non-binary doesn't define themselves exclusively as masculine or feminine‍, and prefers they/them pronouns.

Earlier this year, the singer detailed their experience with their sexuality in an insightful interview with British GQ magazine to celebrate GQ Heroes, admitting to feeling like they don't really fit in, which made them 'really depressed and sad'.

It's just a little crush: Sam recently revealed their huge crush on Harry Styles in a clip entitled My Teenage Self, shared by Hits Radio

Candid: Last month, Sam broke their silence on coming out as non-binary, as the singer told fans to refer to them using 'they/them' pronouns
description: Sam Smith recently came out publicly as non-binary, revealing to fans that they do define themselves exclusively as masculine or feminine.
